column5: Going to be there the frist week of July,the wait is killing me.Anybody else going this year.Fred
Yep. June 17. Last year was our groups first at Nagagami. The camp owner said it was slow, but we thought it was great. I hope this is a normal year to really set the bar high for me.
I just packed my bag redear and having a miller high life. Will be on the road in 2 days and it was a long wait. I,m sure it will be a fast week also. Hang in there. OleJoe

July 9th, first timer. Heard lots of good things from this site. Getting all excited, sorting tackle, cleaning reels, and trying to figure what to take. Staying at a lodge with the American plan. Anybody have any tips on Walleye/Pike/Perch tackle? Don't want to over do it with tackle.

hey Donb We used 3/8 oz chartruse jigs with minniows and sometimes gulp minniows.thats what they wanted.Fished 18 to 29 fow.50 walleyes a day,pike were caught on silver minnows with a twister tail.didn't catch huge pike but saw pictures that other groups earler in the season caught.you don't loose many jigs bottom is mosly sand used 2 jig all week only changed when the paint and hook was woren off to much.I did loose a jointed rebel to a pike.Good Luck Fred
Hey Redear check your private messages.
Headed to Nagagami in 12 days, 18 hours, 32 minutes and 12 seconds, not that I am keeping tabs on it. Talked to David earlier in the week and he said fishing is great. Cant wait!!!
Hey Mark were going to be in cabin #7 this year,so do me a favor and leave a couple of cases of beer under the cabin for us.LOLHave a safe trip buddy.Fred

Hey Fred.. count on finding that beer in #7. ;-) Just hope the guys that are there between our weeks to snatch it. I will hide it...maybe in the fridge. Good luck on your trip and watch dem deers eh? Be careful when you drive!!
